---
title: Docker
author: Mwavu
---

- A `container` is an isolated env. Allows multiple apps to use different 
versions of some software side by side.

> Docker helps us to consistently build, run and ship our applications.

- `docker run -it ubuntu`: start the `ubuntu` image interactively

- A shell takes commands and passes them to the OS.

- `apt` = advanced package tool

- Always run `apt update` before installing a package to update your package database.

- `bin` = binaries

- `etc` = editable text configuration: Stores configuration files

- `>` = standard output redirectional operator:
  - `cat file1.txt file2.txt > file3.txt`
  - `echo file1.txt > newfile.txt`
